Romney, Ryan seek distance on 'legitimate rape' remark

Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan rejected Congressman Todd Akin's views on abortion for rape victims, but their records show slim support for abortion. (Boston Globe)

Crawford to have season-ending surgery

It is expected that the Red Sox outfielder will face six to eight months of rehab after Thursday's Tommy John elbow surgery, meaning he could be ready for Opening Day in 2013. (Boston Globe)
  • 8/20: Crawford's elbow surgery likely imminent | Discuss

Red Sox fire pitching coach Bob McClure

The Red Sox replaced McClure with Randy Niemann, the team's assistant pitching coach, for the remainder of the season. (Boston Globe)

Comedienne Phyllis Diller (left), 95, died Monday and film director Tony Scott, 68, died Sunday.

Clemens returns to baseball

Pitcher Rogers Clemens, 50, on Monday signed with the Sugar Land Skeeters of the independent Atlantic League and is expected to start for them on Saturday. (Boston Globe)
  • 6/18 Clemens acquitted in perjury case  |  Discuss

Traffic stop yields 54 bags of heroin

A routine traffic stop on Saturday triggered by a vehicle’s dark windows led to the arrest of a man and a woman on drug charges, State Police said. (Boston Globe)

Humorist Phyllis Diller died at 95

Phyllis Diller, the housewife turned humorist who aimed some of her sharpest barbs at herself, punctuating her jokes with her trademark cackle, died Monday morning in her Los Angeles home at age 95.
